title: US elections 2024: Who is running for president?
description: As the US presidential campaign heats up, Al Jazeera looks at confirmed and likely candidates ahead of November 2024.

title: Indigenous leader from Brazil wins top environmental prize
description: Alessandra Korap is one of six recipients of the 2023 Goldman Environmental Prize for grassroots activism.

title: What’s driving up global military spending?
description: Military expenditure around the world has hit a new record.

title: US says Sudan factions agree to ceasefire as foreigners evacuated
description: US Secretary of State Anthony Blinken says the truce deal followed intense negotiations and would begin on Tuesday.

title: Bed Bath & Beyond files for US bankruptcy protection
description: One of the original big box retailers, it has had years of dismal sales and losses and said it will close all stores.

title: US envoy to UN urges Russian foreign minister to free detainees
description: At the UN Security Council, US envoy says Paul Whelan and Evan Gershkovich have been used by Moscow as 'human pawns'.

title: Lobby group launched for non-elite European football clubs
description: Union of European Clubs says it aims to represent small and medium-sized clubs in a sport dominated by a rich elite.

title: Several killed in blasts at Pakistan police station
description: Police say there were two explosions inside a 'counterterrorism' police station in Kabal, northwest Pakistan.

title: Man shot dead in Jerusalem after ramming car into civilians
description: Israeli authorities say at least five people, including a 70-year-old, injured in the incident.

title: ‘Sky’s the limit’ for Wrexham after ‘Hollywood’ promotion
description: Welsh club owned by stars Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney promoted back to English Football League after 15 years away.

title: Explainer: What is Nagorno-Karabakh and why are tensions rising?
description: Claimed by Azerbaijan and Armenia after the fall of the Russian Empire in 1917, the area remains a point of tension.

title: Fox News parts ways with influential host Tucker Carlson
description: No reason given for abrupt departure of right-wing commentator, who has been a top host in US cable news.

title: Ex-UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon on surprise Myanmar trip
description: Ban Ki-moon visits military-run Myanmar on behalf of a group of elder statesmen that engage in peacemaking.

title: Why the Turkish elections are a big test for Erdoğan | Start Here
description: The Turkish elections — a turning point?

title: Russian official says ‘Ukrainian’ drone found outside Moscow
description: A district official says Victory Day parade cancelled after drone discovered approximately 30km east of the capital.

title: Venezuela opposition figure Guaido in Colombia ahead of summit
description: Colombia President Gustavo Petro is hosting int'l meeting aimed at resolving political crisis in neighbouring Venezuela.

title: Former US police officer who fatally shot Daunte Wright released
description: Kim Potter, Minnesota officer who mistook gun for Taser and killed Wright in 2021, is freed after 16 months in prison.

title: Photos: Fears, vulnerabilities, divides and dancing in Moldova
description: Moldova, a former Soviet Republic, has become an increasingly visible sideshow of Moscow’s war in Ukraine.

title: ‘Vicious circle’: Femicides in Peru reveal ‘crisis’ of violence
description: A string of high-profile murders has drawn attention to rates of gender-based violence in the South American country.

title: How my family and I left everything and fled Sudan for Egypt
description: When a missile hit Noon Abdel Bassit's home on day four of the conflict, her family made plans to leave the country.

title: South Africa begins evacuation of citizens trapped in Sudan
description: Ramaphosa earlier said South Africa would 'assist other nationals' from 'our region' stranded in Sudan.

title: Death toll in Kenyan starvation cult rises to 58, police say
description: Kenya's police chief says the death toll includes eight people who were initially found emaciated and alive.

title: Indian wrestlers demand arrest of federation chief at sit-in
description: The wrestlers first protested in January but say not enough has been done to end sexual harassment in the sport.

title: Zimbabwe police raid ‘back yard brewers’ as fake booze booms
description: Police are now frequently conducting raids to clamp down on home brewers across Zimbabwe.

title: Ten years of Rana Plaza: How safe is Bangladesh garment industry?
description: The nine-storey building collapsed in 2013, killing 1,134 people, in one of the deadliest industrial disasters ever.

title: Spain exhumes remains of fascist leader Primo de Rivera
description: The Falange party founder became one of the pillars of Francisco Franco's brutal regime.

title: Swimmer Adam Peaty: ‘I’ve been on a self-destructive spiral’
description: British Olympic gold medal winner opens up about his mental heath struggles and his hopes to compete at Paris 2024.

title: Hundreds protest against Arab rapprochement with Syria’s al-Assad
description: Protesters demand Bashar al-Assad be prosecuted, the release of all detainees and the return of displaced Syrians.

title: In famine, ‘f’ is for failure
description: In East Africa, famine is once again looming. We have to act now to save lives.

title: Shahabuddin Chuppu takes oath as Bangladesh’s 22nd president
description: The 74-year-old retired judge of the ruling Awami League party was elected unopposed in February.

title: Second African cheetah dies in India’s Kuno National Park
description: Uday was one of 12 cheetahs brought from South Africa in February in a programme to reintroduce the big cats to India.

title: Son of Putin’s spokesman says he served with Wagner in Ukraine
description: Nikolai Peskov says his father, Dmitry, is 'proud' after his stint fighting against Kyiv's forces.

title: China approves coal surge despite emissions pledge: Greenpeace
description: Approvals of coal-fired power plants fuel concerns that China will backtrack on goal to become carbon neutral by 2060.

title: Sudan fighting in its 10th day: A list of key events
description: Battles raging in Sudan have sparked operations to evacuate foreign citizens and embassy staff by road, air and sea.

title: Russia says drone attack on Crimea port ‘repelled’
description: One drone was shot down while another exploded on its own, Crimea's Russian-backed governor says.

title: ‘Hostages and human shields’: The civilian toll of Sudan’s crisis
description: Residents of Khartoum describe going days without electricity and water as fighting rages around them.

title: Russian shelling as Ukraine forces reportedly cross Dnipro River
description: Russian-installed official denies reports that Kyiv's forces have taken up positions on river's east bank.

title: South Korea restores Japan to trade white list amid warming ties
description: Seoul restores preferential trade status three years after neighbours restricted trade over historical grievances.

title: India’s new airport unsafe due to bird strike risk, activists say
description: Activists say site for Navi Mumbai International Airport is dangerously close to bird sanctuaries and roosting spots.

title: Pakistan’s floods are still targeting millions of children
description: More and more malnourished, dehydrated children are coming to hospitals like mine. It's a legacy of last year's floods.

title: Hambali faces ‘not great, not horrific’ conditions as trial looms
description: Indonesian held in Guantanamo due to appear before a military court with two Malaysians over attacks in Bali, Jakarta.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 425
description: As the war enters its 425th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Australia to strengthen long-range capabilities, northern bases
description: Review marks biggest overhaul of Australian defence policy since World War II.

title: Dozens killed in Burkina Faso attack near Mali border
description: Latest violence comes as country's military leaders step up efforts to put down an uprising that has killed thousands.

title: Jordan says MP held by Israel over alleged arms, gold smuggling
description: Imad al-Adwan is a member of the Jordanian Parliament's Palestine Committee.

title: US asks South Korea not to fill chip shortfalls in China: report
description: South Korean President Yoon Suk-yeol is visiting the US on Monday for a summit with President Joe Biden.

title: World military spending reaches all-time high of $2.24 trillion
description: Surge in spending reflects Russia-Ukraine war and 'increasingly insecure world', according to leading think tank.
